artist: Artist: Katsushika Hokusai; Publisher: Tsuruya Kiemon
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales (Hyaku monogatari 百物語)
signed: 前北斎筆 {Saki no Hokusai hitsu}
text: The plate demon is supposed to be the ghost of Okiku who worked as a maid of a warrior's house, accidentally broke a dish that was treasured by her lord's family. Her angry lord killed her and threw her body in a well in his yard. Kiku became a ghost and haunted around the well.  Many novels were written based on the story, and several different Kabuki plays were also written.
title: The Mansion of the Plates
